metadata.title: CVE-2022-30594 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The Linux kernel before 5.17.2 mishandles seccomp permissions. ThePTRACE_SEIZE code path allows attackers to bypass intended restrictions onsetting the PT_SUSPEND_SECCOMP flag.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-30594` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-180-generic - 4.15.0-180.189
linux-image-4.15.0-180-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-180.189
linux-image-4.15.0-180-lowlatency - 4.15.0-180.189
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-180-generic - 4.15.0-180.189
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-180-lowlatency - 4.15.0-180.189
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-113-generic - 5.4.0-113.127~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-113-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-113.127~18.04.1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-180.189').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-113.127~18.04.1').
